Okay, the OP doesn't want the autopilot.

As a matter of fact, I think I have an example that will help explain what they DO want.

Take two ships 4 parts each: Clamp-o-tron JR, Mk1 pod, LV-T200, and LV-909 engine. Both ships have full fuel tanks, and are in orbit 1km from each other. Notice that I did not mention any kind of RCS. MechJeb would be totally useless to dock these two ships together, except for the orbital information displays. What the OP wants is something that will cause these two ships to be attracted to each other, and align their docking ports.

I think I've watched enough Star Trek and Star Wars to understand what you want: TRACTOR BEAMS!

Actually, I wouldn't mind a plugin that could modify (strengthen/weaken/eliminate) the "magnet" effect between docking ports, because sometimes the game's definition of "close enough" is 'too close', and sometimes it's NOT close enough after all, and those two situations can happen during the same mission in the same ship!

EDIT: It appears that I have been ninja'd several times. I guess I take too long to post.

There are currently no "magnetic field" get-within-1-k-and-station-pulls-you-in mods. In Star Wars, there was no "magnetic fields" to pull you in, but there was Tractor Beams used by the Galactic Empire. Back on topic, I recommend watching some docking tutorials. It really is quite easy once you get the hang of it, similar to riding a bicycle.
